cyclone.name: BONNIE
cyclone.current_location: about 435 miles southeast of Charleston, South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: continuing west-northwest, expected to slow and turn northward, making landfall in South Carolina then tracking NE inland across the Carolinas and emerging off the Mid-Atlantic coast toward the open Atlantic

weather_observation.watch_coast: Savannah River to Little River Inlet, SC (tropical storm watch/warning area south of the port)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Savannah River to Little River Inlet, SC (Tropical Storm Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Georgia and South Carolina coasts northward through North Carolina and into southeast Virginia and the southern Chesapeake Bay
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions with occasional tropical-storm-force gusts (generally <40 mph) possible Monday night into Tuesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1 ft or less possible in the lower Chesapeake Bay and along the immediate coast
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–3 inches of rainfall possible Monday–Tuesday with localized higher amounts
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf, dangerous rip currents, and brief coastal inundation at high tide
